SEARCH
Package upei.project

Class GameTest

java.lang.Object
upei.project.GameTest
public class GameTest extends Object
Unit tests for the Game class, ensuring that the game's initialization, player management, scenarios (such as Jail and Go to Jail), and winner determination work as expected.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameTest

      public GameTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()
      Initializes the test environment by creating players with strategies and setting up the game. This method is run before each test to ensure the tests start with a clean state.

    • testGameInitialization

      @Test public void testGameInitialization()
      Tests the game initialization to ensure the game object and players are correctly initialized. Verifies that the game and players are properly set up.

    • testPlayerElimination

      @Test public void testPlayerElimination()
      Tests the player elimination scenario where a player goes bankrupt and is eliminated from the game. Verifies that the player is removed from the game and the remaining player is the winner.

    • testJailScenario

      @Test public void testJailScenario()
      Tests the Jail scenario where a player is placed in Jail. Verifies that the player is correctly added to jail and remains there after an action is taken.

    • testGoToJailScenario

      @Test public void testGoToJailScenario()
      Tests the Go to Jail scenario where a player lands on a "Go to Jail" space. Verifies that the player is sent to jail correctly when they land on the "Go to Jail" space.

    • testWinningCondition

      @Test public void testWinningCondition()
      Tests the winning condition in the game. Verifies that the game correctly identifies the winner when a player's balance reaches the winning threshold.

    • testDetermineWinner

      @Test public void testDetermineWinner()
      Tests the winner determination logic where the game determines the winner based on the player's balance and properties. Verifies that the game correctly identifies the player with the highest value, including balance and properties.
